projects.title: GoWatchIt: Superwidget
projects.description: An API-backed embeddable SDK and theming engine for film releases, TV airdates, and advertising campaigns. Served millions of times a month across the web from major studio properties (Universal, Sony, Paramount, FOX) to large content sites (NYTimes, Buzzfeed, Entertainment Weekly).

projects.title: GoWatchIt: Consumer Site
projects.description: Fully responsive consumer web application. Redesigned existing outdated website through managing stakeholders, freelancers, and team members.

projects.title: GoWatchIt: Dashboard
projects.description: Fully featured content management system (CMS) for film and TV studios. Real-time analytics, custom reporting, and visual asset creation and theming (think Google Analytics and Squarespace for film/TV releases)

projects.title: Wetfeet: Grad Report
projects.description: Wetfeet, owned by Universum, had exclusive survey data gathered from hundreds of thousands of exiting college students around the world. This interactive report profiled the student and let him or her visualize the results.

projects.title: DueProps: Branding and Redesign
projects.description: An HR management app for employee recognition started by (in)famous Ruby and Rails developer and author Obie Fernandez.

projects.title: Flatiron School: Branding
projects.description: Fledgling coding bootcamp needed to make its mark. I worked as Campus Director in the inaugural cohort, handling admissions, events, employer outreach, marketing, social media â€” and yes, branding.

projects.title: Breed Breakdown
projects.description: An interactive tool to help the new dog owner find the perfect breed based on their ideal preferences. It has received over 2 million unique visits without an ad spend.

projects.title: Scraps
projects.description: Things that don't fit nicely elsewhere: Crafts, past resume iterations, logo experiments, type treatments, and interesting mistakes.
